exm.mng: old place name (in Yan of Warring states, in modern Beijing city)
fishing and hunting, fig. to loot, to plunder
Li Yu (1611-c. 1680), late Ming and early Qing writer and dramatist

exm.cur: 授人以鱼不如授人以渔
exm.trd: 授人以魚不如授人以漁
exm.mng: give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime, knowledge is the best charity
exm.pyn: shòu rén yǐ yú bù rú shòu rén yǐ yú

exm.mng: lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both, idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
exm.pyn: yù bàng xiāng zhēng yú wēng dé lì

exm.mng: percussion instrument in the form of a bamboo fish (traditionally used by Daoist priests)
